original: FRÖMAN, Nils Otto, Civilin gren jör, Storängen, f Sthlm 8/6 74 av civ.ing O L F o Hedvig Malmstedt, gm (1) Lisa Lindberg, (2) Elsa Holmberg. Mog.ex NReal Sthlm 94, KTH (V o V) 94—98, utl stud v bl a bad-, slakthus- o spårvägsanläggn. Bitr ing v Gbgs stads byggn.kont 98, arb.ch v Strängnäs stads vatten- o avloppsledn nybyggn 98—99, konstr o posthav ing Sthlms stads vattenledn.vks nybyggn Norsborg 00—04, tekn ch AB Beton Sthlm 04—05, bitr ing Sthlms stads byggn.kont 05, arb.ch Sthlms stads slakthusanläggn Enskede 06—12, byråing Sthlms stads byggn.kont samt sekr där 12—25, sakk h Sthlms stdsflm :s bad- o tvätthuskté 17—21, ing Sthlms stads gatukont 25—39, ing h Nacka kommun 39—43. Projekt varmbadhus- o fri-luftsbadanläggn. Kommunalflm Nacka 21— 34, ordf Nacka hälsov.nmd 22—43, ordf byggn.-nmdn f Storängens egnahemsomr 17—22. Styr.led Sv Frn f Folkbad o i dess vkst utsk fr 21, sekr där 21—35; Styr.led Sv Tekn.frn 98, sekr i dess avd V 07—08, Av trycket: Sthlms stads slakthus (14), Städernas badfråga (17), ett flert art i tekn o administr ämnen. RVO, PatrstGM.
translated: FRÖMAN, Nils Otto, Civil engineer, Storängen, born in Stockholm on 8 June 1874, son of civil engineer O.L.F. Fröman and Hedvig Malmstedt. Married (1) to Lisa Lindberg, (2) to Elsa Holmberg. Graduated from NReal Stockholm in 1894, studied at KTH (V and V) from 1894 to 1898, and also studied abroad in various locations, including bathhouses, slaughterhouses, and tramway facilities. Assistant engineer at the City Building Office in Gothenburg from 1898, working as a construction engineer at Strängnäs City Water and Sewerage Infrastructure from 1898 to 1899, as a designer and post engineer at Stockholm City Water Infrastructure in Norsborg from 1900 to 1904, as a technical chief at AB Beton Stockholm from 1904 to 1905, as an assistant engineer at the City Building Office in Stockholm in 1905, working at the Enskede City Slaughterhouse facilities from 1906 to 1912, as a bureau engineer at the City Building Office in Stockholm from 1912 to 1925, as an expert at Stockholm City Film's bathhouses and laundry houses task committee from 1917 to 1921, as an engineer at Stockholm City's Street Office from 1925 to 1939, and as an engineer at Nacka Municipality from 1939 to 1943. Involved in projects related to warm bathhouses and open-air swimming facilities. Municipal film committee member in Nacka from 1921 to 1934, chairman of the Nacka Health Committee from 1922 to 1943, chairman of the building committee in Storängen's residential area from 1917 to 1922. Board member of the Swedish People's Bath Association and secretary from 1921 to 1935; board member of the Swedish Technical Society from 1898, secretary of its V section from 1907 to 1908. Published several works, including "Stockholm City Slaughterhouses" (1914) and "The Question of Bathhouses in Cities" (1917), as well as numerous articles on technical and administrative subjects. Honored with the Order of Vasa (RVO) and Patriotic Society Gold Medal (PatrstGM).
